Paper: Antisocial behavior corpus for harmful language detection

Dataset:
web corpus (148 post)
ISEAR
Movie reviews(200)
Wikipedia text extract

venue: Federated Conference on Computer Science and Information Systems
Comments: the results are not reliable as they don't have balanced datase.

Paper: Ex Machina: Personal Attacks Seen at Scale
Definition of Cyber-Bullyning:
A recent Pew Research Center study defines on line harassment to include being: called offensive names, purpose
fully embarrassed, stalked, sexually harassed, physically threat ened, and harassed in a sustained manner [5].
Dataset:
Wkipedia talk pages (115,737)
randomly sampled (37611)
bloxked sampled (78126)
Data Collection process:
data labelled using Figure eight with 10 workers for each text 
with Krippendof alpha 0.45
Oversampleing pst instances:
1- random sampling
2- block sampling (In order to obtain these, we enhance our random dataset by also sampling comments made by users who where blocked for violating Wikipediaâ€™s policy on personal attacks [33].)
Text Feature:
BOW n-gram words 
and n-gram characters
AUC:
LR = ED label  (cahr)96.4 (words) 95.55
MLP = ED label (char) 96.15 (word) 96.59
Comments:
they use 2 ways of labelling the data:
1- Onehot vcot (OH) each post is 1 (positive) and 0 (negative)
2- empirical distribution (ED) with each post has a probabiltty of postive or negative based on the labelling from Crowdsourcing.

Paper: Deep Learning for Detecting Cyberbullying Across Multiple Social Media Platforms
Definition of Cyber-Bullyning:
Cyberbullying has been defined by the National Crime Prevention Council as
the use of the Internet, cell phones or other devices to send or post text or images
intended to hurt or embarrass another person.
Dataset positive sample:
Formspring (825 = 6.8%)
Twitter (3117 sexism = 19.4%)
Twitter (1957 racis = 12.2%)
Wikipedia (13,590 = 13.59%)
Data Collection process:
Formspring (AMT - 3 workers no inter-annotator agreement)
Twitter (Labelled by ressearchers)
Wikipedia (crowdflower - 10 workers - 0.45 agreement score)
Oversampleing pst instances: oversample bullying class data by 3 times
Text Feature:
BOW n-gram words 
BOW n-gram characters
Glove
SSWE
Deel Learning model: CNN, LSTM, BLSTM, BLSTM + attention, CNN
Innovative model:
using transfer learning
 to learn between
 different platforms
Comments:
1-We have shown that DNN models can be used for cyberbullying detection on
various topics across multiple SMPs using three datasets and four DNN models.
These models coupled with transfer learning beat state of the art results for
all three datasets.
